articles.headline: Blackstone Founders Prepare to Count Their Billions
articles.snippet: The giant private equity firm, founded by Stephen Schwarzman and Peter Peterson, is expected to go public in the next few weeks.
articles.abstract: The giant private equity firm, founded by Stephen Schwarzman and Peter Peterson, is expected to go public in the next few weeks.
articles.lead_paragraph: Meet Wall Street’s soon-to-be $8 billion man, Stephen A. Schwarzman, and his $3 billion partner, Peter G. Peterson.

articles.headline: A Compass That Can Clash With Modern Life
articles.snippet: Religious and political leaders say that there is a crisis in Islam because too many religious edicts are being issued.
articles.abstract: Religious and political leaders say that there is a crisis in Islam because too many religious edicts are being issued.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAIRO, June 11 — First came the breast-feeding fatwa. It declared that the Islamic restriction on unmarried men and women being together could be lifted at work if the woman breast-fed her male colleagues five times, to establish family ties. Then came the urine fatwa. It said that drinking the urine of the Prophet Muhammad was deemed a blessing.

articles.headline: U.S. Warns Iraq That Progress Is Needed Soon
articles.snippet: A top U.S. commander told Iraq’s premier to make political progress by next month to counter the growing tide of opposition to the war in Congress.
articles.abstract: A top U.S. commander told Iraq’s premier to make political progress by next month to counter the growing tide of opposition to the war in Congress.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD, June 11 — The top American military commander for the Middle East has warned Iraq’s prime minister in a closed-door conversation that the Iraqi government needs to make tangible political progress by next month to counter the growing tide of opposition to the war in Congress.

articles.headline: For a Russian Builder of Nuclear Plants, Business Is Booming
articles.snippet: The Russian nuclear power company Atomstroyexport has been roundly criticized for helping Iran build its nuclear program. Yet it hasn’t hurt business.
articles.abstract: The Russian nuclear power company Atomstroyexport has been roundly criticized for helping Iran build its nuclear program. Yet it hasn’t hurt business.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, June 6 — The Russian nuclear power company Atomstroyexport has been roundly criticized for helping Iran build its nuclear program. But neither that project nor the company’s mouthful of a name has hurt its business prospects.

articles.headline: Incentives Limit Any Savings in Treating Cancer
articles.snippet: The ballooning cost of cancer treatment offers an example of how difficult it may be to rein in the nation’s runaway health care spending.
articles.abstract: The ballooning cost of cancer treatment offers an example of how difficult it may be to rein in the nation’s runaway health care spending.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Medicare cracked down two years ago on profits that doctors made on drugs they administered to patients in their offices, it ended a windfall worth hundreds of thousands of dollars a year for each physician.

articles.headline: For Yahoo, an Ordeal of Dissent
articles.snippet: Terry S. Semel, Yahoo’s chief executive, is facing mounting questions about internal morale problems.
articles.abstract: Terry S. Semel, Yahoo’s chief executive, is facing mounting questions about internal morale problems.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, June 11  When Terry S. Semel, Yahoo’s chief executive, faces shareholders at the company’s annual meeting on Tuesday, Eric Jackson will be there to pepper him with questions.

articles.headline: Effort to Advise on Risky Loans Runs Into Snag
articles.snippet: Critics in Illinois complained that a mandatory mortgage counseling program amounted to government intrusion.
articles.abstract: Critics in Illinois complained that a mandatory mortgage counseling program amounted to government intrusion.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO, June 7 — With a growing number of homeowners running into problems paying their mortgages, Illinois came up with an idea to protect people like Cassandra McKinney from lenders — and themselves.

articles.headline: Flight Snags Are Arriving on Schedule
articles.snippet: This year is shaping up to be the worst ever for delays, and there will be lots of blame to go around, and lots of finger-pointing.
articles.abstract: This year is shaping up to be the worst ever for delays, and there will be lots of blame to go around, and lots of finger-pointing.
articles.lead_paragraph: The nation’s air-travel system fell apart again last Friday night, when the space shuttle Atlantis was just about the only flight that was on time on the East Coast.
